comments:
Hi,

In EMF, when I do a new project based on an XML schema containing an element 
whose restriction is either a length restriction or a pattern restriction, the 
GUI tells me "Specify a valid XML schema and try again".

I notice it does work with with an enumeration restriction.

Attached are the schema that cause the failure and failure log.


************* START TestLengthRestriction.xsd ************* 
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<xs:schema xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" 
elementFormDefault="qualified" attributeFormDefault="unqualified">
	<xs:simpleType name="restrictedLengthType">
		<xs:annotation>
			<xs:documentation>Type defining a name 
string</xs:documentation>
		</xs:annotation>
		<xs:restriction base="xs:string">
			<xs:maxLength value="30"/>
		</xs:restriction>
	</xs:simpleType>
</xs:schema>

************* END TestLengthRestriction.xsd *************

************* START TestPatternRestriction.xsd *************
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<xs:schema xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" 
elementFormDefault="qualified" attributeFormDefault="unqualified">
	<xs:simpleType name="ipAddressType">
		<xs:annotation>
			<xs:documentation>Type defining an IP 
address</xs:documentation>
		</xs:annotation>
		<xs:restriction base="xs:string">
			<xs:pattern value="(\d{1,3}\.){3}\d{1,3}"/>
		</xs:restriction>
	</xs:simpleType>
</xs:schema>
************* END TestPatternRestriction.xsd *************

Also doesn't work with Inclusive restrictions

************* START TestInclusiveRestriction.xsd ************* 
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<xs:schema xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" 
elementFormDefault="qualified" attributeFormDefault="unqualified">
	<xs:simpleType name="inclusiveValueType">
		<xs:annotation>
			<xs:documentation>Inclusive<xs:documentation>
		</xs:annotation>
		<xs:restriction base="xs:int">
			<xs:minInclusive value="0"/>
			<xs:maxInclusive value="100"/>
		</xs:restriction>
	</xs:simpleType>
</xs:schema>
************* END TestInclusiveRestriction.xsd *************

Keith,

This

Caused by: java.lang.NullPointerException
	at org.apache.crimson.tree.ElementNode2.getAttributeNodeNS(Unknown 
Source)

is the "Crimson DOM" problem, i.e., a bug in the JDK's DOM implementation.  We
provide instructions for how to avoid the problems in this DOM implementation by
substutiting a different DOM implementation:

  http://eclipse.org/emf/downloads-xerces.php
